intro: Uapaca angustipyrena, commonly known as the narrow-leaf velvetball, is a deciduous shrub native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, rounded clusters of small, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by spherical, red berries containing edible seeds. It is adapted to thrive in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in savanna and woodland ecosystems. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
